Even people I never expected compliments me when i wear this</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2323671"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2323671#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2323465" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2323465" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Abeer Alatrash"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2134624"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2134624.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Abeer Alatrash" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2323465ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2323465" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2134624">Abeer Alatrash</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-22">10/22/24 00:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have tested it in a perfume store, This perfume is very Gourmand warm sweety vanilla with less amount of Lavender and spicy Ginger which these ingrediants are not annoying or heavy, this fragrance in the dry down became deepy vanilla reminds me the vanilla exists in "Manifesto Yves Saint Laurent", but with more cacao, also this mixture of  cacao with vanilla reminds me with "Nebras Lattafa Perfume",but "Nebras Lattafa Perfume" is deeper, denser and sweeter perfume. I didn't see that this perfume similar to "Mon Guerlain" hence, the vanilla in "Mon Guerlain" is more intense and pure, also Lavender here is lighter.<br />
<br />
If you didn't smell this perfume before, I advise that you can blind buy if you interest the gourmand fragrances. sweety notes here not a cause for headache for you. Also Vanilla here is very suitable for women who are looking for a delicious vanilla fragrance tends to be more balanced dry down rather being intense.<br />
<br />
This fragrance suitable to wear it at night, in winter or Autumn seasons, It lasts 12 hours on the leather and more than one day or more on clothes.<br />
<br />
                                           "    "                "  "  "  "            " "     " "        .<br />
<br />
                .                                     .<br />
<br />
            12          .</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2323465"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2323465#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2323102" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2323102" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Strawbunnee"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1868586"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1868586.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Strawbunnee" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2323102ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2323102" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1868586">Strawbunnee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-21">10/21/24 14:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I tried to like this one, I really did--but I can't. I don't think I even would say it's an OKAY scent. This is one of the few I just dislike. First time I smelled it in the store, I liked it! But then after a tester I can say absolutely not. I hardly get any vanilla. The opening is nice, but the dry down is straight rubber for me. I don't smell any vanilla. This is 100% an unsafe blind buy, I highly recommend anyone who is interested to smell in-person and test first, because I thought I'd love it but it's the opposite!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2323102"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2323102#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2322570" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2322570" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JoyDivision"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1580180"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1580180.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="JoyDivision" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Miss-Dior-Blooming-Bouquet-23280.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.23280.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Miss Dior Blooming Bouquet"title="Miss Dior Blooming Bouquet"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2322570ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2322570" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1580180">JoyDivision</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-21">10/21/24 05:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I expected a rich vanilla honey gourmand, but instead, its a vanilla-honey-lavender-cocoa blend that comes close to crossing into gourmand territory without quite making it. The lavender adds a sweet, slightly powdery note, while the honey deepens the vanilla. The result is a sophisticated fall-winter fragrancesubtle and inoffensive, perfect for the office or a casual brunch. It could easily work as an early evening scent, though it lacks the depth for a true night-out perfume.<br />
<br />
P.S. The lavender gives me hints of Lancmes Hypnse, especially the pre-reformulation version when it first launched.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2322570"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2322570#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2321849" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2321849" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SiddhantSuryawanshi"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1690312"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1690312.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="SiddhantSuryawanshi" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Royal-Oud-12317.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.12317.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Royal Oud"title="Royal Oud"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2321849ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2321849" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1690312">SiddhantSuryawanshi</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-20">10/20/24 09:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Shes perfect, isnt she? Thats the problem. You meet her at a rooftop party, everyones eyes on her, but somehow, she only sees you. Or at least, thats what she makes you believe.<br />
<br />
She tells you everything youve ever wanted to hear, all while holding you at arms length. You try to get closer, but theres a coldness beneath her perfection, a distance youll never bridge. The longer you stay, the more you realize shes hollow inside, a shell crafted to be worshipped but never touched.<br />
<br />
When she finally walks away, youre left reeling, clinging to the traces of her scent; rich lavender, soft vanilla, and the faintest hint of Cacao. Thats Goddess: a divine figure youll never be worthy of, no matter how hard you try.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2321849"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2321849#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2320813" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2320813" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="blurustc"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1850484"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1850484.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="blurustc" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2320813ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2320813" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1850484">blurustc</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-19">10/19/24 10:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>boring and one-dimensional, unlike the other commenters i do smell the vanilla but theres just nothing special about this perfume, its very meh, not worth the hype</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2320813"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2320813#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2320778" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I think I found the best vanilla scent that matches my body chem. I outgrown my signature scent, AG Cloud and now I appreciate vanilla + lavender and hint of florals. This is cozy and decadent, I love it when it dries down. It's just sad that it doesn't last that long on me, probably 2 hours max. But I just love wearing it because I can't stop smelling myself!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2315377"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2315377#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2314755" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I'm going to have fun finding other fragrances to layer this with this fall/winter (other thank Kayali 28 and sol de Janeiro 62)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2314755"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2314755#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2314394" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2314394" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Romyscent"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2259355"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2259355.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Romyscent" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/L-Instant-de-Guerlain-51.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.51.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="L'Instant de Guerlain"title="L'Instant de Guerlain"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2314394ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2314394" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2259355">Romyscent</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-13">10/13/24 09:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a very simple and linear scent. You get lavender vanilla from start to finish. I like that it's syrupy-sweet but not overpowering. The vanilla is more prominent than the lavender, which is good because I'm not the biggest fan of lavender in perfumes. I can definitely detect the ginger. It makes it a bit spicy, and the cocoa just adds depth. Overall, it's a simple elegant vanilla.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2314394"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2314394#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2313597" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2313597" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Faverinsky"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/865947"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.865947.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Faverinsky" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mugler/Angel-Fantasm-91916.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.91916.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Angel Fantasm"title="Angel Fantasm"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2313597ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2313597" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/865947">Faverinsky</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-12">10/12/24 14:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Rats! After a year (and one "meh" review) of hating and resisting this perfume ("nothing but watered down Vanilla 28 with some cocoa and faint lavender"), I finally gave in and ordered me a 100ml bottle. Say what you will about its lack of longevity, projection issues, and lack of real personality and originality... well call me a basic b*atch but this is so uncomplicated, easy-going, feminine vanilla goodness, and I'm here for it!<br />
<br />
If you're like me, who tends to go for full-bodied and robust sillage monsters, you'll probably appreciate this scent most in the spring (anytime) and in the summer (evenings), because it's rather soft and airy, but still quite sweet. Another great option is to layer it with your fave coconut-centered body mist (like Rio Radiance, At the Beach, or Coco Paradise), and voila! An uncomplicated summer-appropriate gourmand is born!<br />
<br />
PS: If you're interested in finding out what "turned" me towards this perfume, and why I think it's worthwhile; it's because I love Mon Guerlain Intense (especially the intense vanilla and lavender combo), but I cannot wear this potion in warmer weather, it's too cloying, but Burberry Goddess is not! So yes, they are a little similar, but the ginger, cacao and toned-down aromatic notes sets them apart.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2313597"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2313597#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2313154" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2313154" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="pipnpoppy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/393996"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="pipnpoppy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2313154ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2313154" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/393996">pipnpoppy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-12">10/12/24 07:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>How this smells on clothes is to die for- creamy cosy vanilla. <br />
On my skin i smell lavender ginger and the vanilla. It has a pleasant vanilla dry down but theres a smoky phase before we get there that I dont love, but I put up with it as I love the other stages.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; At first, it was a burst of lavender. Usually, I'm not too fond of lavender but it was creamy and deepened to vanilla-centered dry down.. I left the store but I could not stop thinking about it. I immediately ordered it online.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2312538"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2312538#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2312234" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; The lavender is potent but not overpowering. Unfortunately, it only lasts about 4 hours, but it's still a staple in my collection.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2312234"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2312234#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2311974" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Kinda vibe with this perfume, even if I would definitely not wear it everyday and definitely not when it is hot outside.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2311974"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2311974#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2311341" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2311341" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Neaau"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1909233"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1909233.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Neaau" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jean-Paul-Gaultier/Le-Male-430.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.430.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Le Male"title="Le Male"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2311341ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2311341" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1909233">Neaau</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-10">10/10/24 11:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I dont know what on earth is happening. I got a 10ml travel size of goddess like 2 months ago, so I could really test it on my skin before making a hasted purchase.<br />
<br />
I tested it, smelled like a very generic white flower forward perfume, didnt like it, and forgot about it. <br />
Now I was cleaning out my cabinet and it caught my eye, I tested it on my hand, yeah very perfumey, alright. Washed my hands, continued house chores. A while passes, but- wait, why do I keep smelling Lattafa Yara everywhere? <br />
The Burberry Goddess turned into Lattafa Yara on my skin, after I tried to wash it away? What is happening. Its projecting alright. I could've used this deadly combo this whole time but just went about my business thinking Goddess was just a very perfumey perfume???? Im an idiot. It obviously needed to macerate.<br />
<br />
I know what Im wearing tomorrow .</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2311341"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2311341#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2311271" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2311271" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="iwanttobereal"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2281490"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2281490.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="iwanttobereal" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2311271ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2311271" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2281490">iwanttobereal</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-10">10/10/24 10:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I just don't get the hype for this perfume. It's been talked heavily about as a vanilla fragrance, but I mostly just get the lavender and even the ginger, but not much of the vanilla. I've sniffed it every time I've come across it in the stores, trying to see if I just remember wrong and to see if I'd like it this time (I never do).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2311271"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2311271#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2310102" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2310102" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MalibuMermaid"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1757701"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1757701.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MalibuMermaid" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Coco-Mademoiselle-611.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.611.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Coco Mademoiselle"title="Coco Mademoiselle"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2310102ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2310102" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1757701">MalibuMermaid</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-09">10/09/24 10:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>These reviews are so interesting seeing how everyone has a different take on if this fragrance is lavender forward or vanilla forward. On my skin it is very lavender forward and it stays that way for hours. I love lavender and the hint of vanilla makes it very pretty, so Im all for this. Not a lot of projection for me, but Im using a small decant without an atomizer so its hard to gauge how much to put on, but it definitely has less projection than most fragrances that I try. Goddess is fresh and youthful (but not child youthful). Its the kind of fragrance you can go anywhere wearing and not feel overdone.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2310102"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2310102#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2309815" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2309815" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="adrienn99"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/27130"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.27130.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="adrienn99" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Etat-Libre-d-Orange/Noel-au-Balcon-2195.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.2195.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Noel au Balcon"title="Noel au Balcon"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2309815ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2309815" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/27130">adrienn99</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-09">10/09/24 05:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love vanilla but this...will be ranting here, so those who take negative reviews as insult please jog on.<br />
<br />
So I love vanilla, love lavender. This delivers neither (also let's not insult Mon guerlain with similarity please)<br />
<br />
The 'vanilla' here is reminiscent of wunderbaum vanilla. Also had a vanilla toilet refresher which smelled similarly artificial. Poor lavender.<br />
<br />
Now, this may have been a joke on Burberry side, thinking juice was crapola but let's name it fancy and cash will flow. Akin to muglers womanity which was similarly hideous.<br />
<br />
Being a woman, being a goddess is hard enough already, please do justice with something tolerable at least.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2309815"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2309815#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2308297" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2308297" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="allisonswimsak"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2224894"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="allisonswimsak" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2308297ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2308297" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2224894">allisonswimsak</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-07">10/07/24 18:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>all i get is lavender and a little spice, no vanilla :( as a gourmand lover, this is a miss for me. I'm glad i got a decant instead of blind buying. will let it sit and see if it needs to macerate</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2308297"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2308297#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2308190" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2308190" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="nicole.3"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2182508"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2182508.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="nicole.3" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Issey-Miyake/A-Drop-d-Issey-66334.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.66334.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="A Drop d'Issey"title="A Drop d'Issey"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2308190ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2308190" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2182508">nicole.3</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-07">10/07/24 15:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A nurse who cared for my son during a brief hospital stint smelled amazing to the point I couldn't not ask her what fragrance she was wearing! She told me it was Burberry Goddess and how she absolutely loved it too. I actually ordered a decant later that day. Ha! Suffice to say, I either got a weird batch and/or my body chemistry reacts to this perfume TOTALLY differently. On her, it was all vanilla with hints of cocoa and spice (virtually no noticeable floral), and on me, it remains straight up lavender and ginger for hours after application and is oddly similar to Black Opium which I'm not a big fan of. Maybe it'll improve with age and smell a bit less like every mass produced designer fragrance, but for now I'm just really glad I bought a 5 ML instead of a full bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2308190"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2308190#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2308154" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2308154" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="memery1010"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2217355"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2217355.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="memery1010" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2308154ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2308154" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2217355">memery1010</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-07">10/07/24 14:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I was worried this would be a boring scent considering the vanilla top, middle and basenotes. But I was very pleasantly surprised. It actually doesn't immediately strike me as a vanilla scent. It's softly powdery, gently sweet, and has an understated elegance that feels safe for every day use. And in that way, it reminds me of vanilla. <br />
<br />
The mental collage it conjures for me consists of baby powder, a tray of pastries, silk fabric and professionally curled hair.<br />
<br />
I've immediately gotten compliments on this scent from some very picky noses. I can't wait to put it on in the morning, and it makes me smile throughout the day.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2308154"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2308154#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2307845" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2307845" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Trina.RDMS"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2192056"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Trina.RDMS" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2307845ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2307845" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2192056">Trina.RDMS</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-07">10/07/24 10:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The rave reviews for this baffle me! There are obvious performance and quality control issues with this perfume. I did love the scent when I tried it in store, so I was excited to purchase a 100ml bottle. (From a reputable dealer, so I know it's genuine) I was so disappointed to find I could barely smell anything, even when overspraying. It has virtually no reach and 30 min later, I couldn't even smell it on my skin or clothes.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2307845"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2307845#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2307002" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2268656">SadieS</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-06">10/06/24 13:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love this scent so much! I think the longevity is pretty good, but for the love of me I cannot get it to project. All of you who gets complimented on it, how much do you spray?<br />
<br />
Ive been overspraying like crazy, on my body, hair, clothes, yet no one can smell it unless they lean in really close. Im not getting any compliments because no one can smell it. Ive asked friends and family if the can smell any perfume on me, like 30 min to an hour or two after Ive put on a ton - and I always get a no.<br />
<br />
However, I can smell it myself and I do get little whiffs from myself from time to time, I just wish someone else could smell it too.<br />
<br />
Update: after choking myself out overspraying one morning (20 sprays or so) I actually got a compliment by a work colleague at about 2 pm who walked by me so it can happen.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2306984"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2306984#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2306282" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1515672">jarofscents</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-05">10/05/24 18:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This perfume layered with Sol De Janeiro '40 smells divine. I get compliments wherever I go. My boyfriend is so addicted to my scent that he bought me more bottles of Goddess and SDJ '40. Perfect for date night!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2306282"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2306282#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2305085" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2305085" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="aliicebby"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2265349"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2265349.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="aliicebby" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2305085ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2305085" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2265349">aliicebby</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-04">10/04/24 15:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I was drawn to this fragrance for its triple vanilla notes and had high expectations of indulging in a rich, warm vanilla scent. Unfortunately, the ginger and lavender notes overpower the vanilla, leaving me disappointed. The scent is sophisticated, but the imbalance between the notes doesn't allow the vanilla to shine as I had hoped.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2305085"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2305085#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2304959" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2304959" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SlightlyUnderwhelmed"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2276146"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2276146.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="SlightlyUnderwhelmed" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2304959ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2304959" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2276146">SlightlyUnderwhelmed</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-04">10/04/24 14:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I bought a small bottle of this and got multiple compliments on it. However, personally, I don't really get vanilla. I get a sexy warm lavender scent once it dries down, which does last quite a while, but just not really much vanilla. It's smells classy anyways so I don't mind much about the lack of vanilla. I'll let it macerate a while longer and see if anything changes.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2304959"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2304959#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2304163" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2304163" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="emmaksmith"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2135518"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2135518.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="emmaksmith" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Glossier/You-46885.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.46885.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="You"title="You"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2304163ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2304163" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.89); I didn't get a lot of vanilla... but plenty of lavender and spice.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2304163"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2304163#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2302783" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2302783" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Mzks101012mx5"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1837970"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Mzks101012mx5" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.83483.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Goddess"title="Goddess"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2302783ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2302783" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1837970">Mzks101012mx5</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-02">10/02/24 14:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Is there anyone selling it?</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex;
