Didnt like it. I thought I would</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2278470"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2278470#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2277770" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2277770" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="yaseminh"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2075443"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="yaseminh" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2277770ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2277770" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2075443">yaseminh</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-10">09/10/24 04:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>One of the best vanilla perfumes out there. Easy blind buy IMO unless you dislike lavender. After about 5 minutes lavender vanishes and you have this gorgeous vanilla scent that's so soft and easy to wear and even the lavender is not harsh or headache-inducing in my opinion. The only bad thing is that projection and longevity are not very strong.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2277770"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2277770#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2273252" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2273252" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Saveria"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1847747"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1847747.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Saveria" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chopard/Casmir-348.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.348.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Casmir"title="Casmir"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2273252ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2273252" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1847747">Saveria</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-06">09/06/24 00:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>At first spray, it's a huge whiff of lavender. It then fades to give way to vanilla which I find - for my part - very sweet. I am surprised not to find any citrus fruits in the pyramid because for me, there is no doubt, there are some. I even find it very fruity and acidulous.<br />
<br />
Once the lavender gone and the scent stabilized - and even if the two remain different - I find strong similarities with Good Girl; vanilla, citrus and sugar with this acidulous side.<br />
<br />
From my point of view, Goddess is not bad but does not present anything transcendent and above all, it is 'dj vu' and better done by others. For my part, I find no connection with Mon Guerlain which I find much more delicate and floral.<br />
<br />
The kind of perfume to try yourself because, obviously, not many people agree...</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2273252"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2273252#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2273126" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2273126" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="aeterna"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/671444"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.671444.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="aeterna" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jo-Malone-London/Ginger-Biscuit-Cologne-2023-87708.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.87708.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ginger Biscuit Cologne (2023)"title="Ginger Biscuit Cologne (2023)"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2273126ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2273126" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/671444">aeterna</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-05">09/05/24 20:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>On my skin this smells like Cheirosa 62 (origial Sol de Janeiro) scent.<br />
I dislike Cheirosa because it smells sharp, synthetic and cheap to me, however Goddess is like a refined and expensive version of it which I actually really like. Definitely well-blended.<br />
I don't notice any lavender here - again, this might be due to my skin's chemistry.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2273126"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2273126#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2272708" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2272708" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="coraline28"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1378821"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1378821.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="coraline28" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2272708ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2272708" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78); The dry down is almost the same as Kayali Vanilla.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2272708"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2272708#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2272509" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1409653">wenshere</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-05">09/05/24 09:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Classy, cozy, elegant. It reminds me of Mon Guerlain but without the licorice, I like it! The vanilla in this has a lot of dimension and is executed in a very interesting way. It borders on gourmand but it's also not at the same time. It smells super smooth and sophisticated, I can totally see a lady rocking this as her signature scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2272509"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2272509#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2272374" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; An allrounder. <br />
<br />
It's bright yet soft.<br />
Elegant yet cozy.<br />
It's a crowd pleaser but has character.<br />
<br />
The lavender adds an interesting note and elevates the otherwise typical sweet vanilla fragrance. <br />
<br />
Lasts well enough on clothes.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2269699"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2269699#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2268660" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2264773" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="kodeined"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2236473"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2236473.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="kodeined" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2264773ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2264773" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2236473">kodeined</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-29">08/29/24 09:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Just like the name itself, this is *my* goddess of my shelf (after Montblanc Signature ofc.) I have the most untrained nose in the West, so my descriptions may sound terribly wrong to you. <br />
<br />
But the combination of vanilla and lavender reminds me of (green) tea in general. Or very mellow dried down black tea leaves. I tend to like those kinds of smells in general. The lavender is pretty strong in the opening and I *can* smell the vanilla beneath, but it doesn't hit you in the head like other vanilla scents. It doesn't scream vanilla to me, so that's why I like it a lot. <br />
<br />
Think of a cup of warm black tea that's HEAVILY sugared, yeah.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2264773"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2264773#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2264491" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2264491" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="flynne19"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1710560"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="flynne19" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2264491ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2264491" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1710560">flynne19</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-29">08/29/24 03:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>For some reason, I thought this would be super strong, right in your face vanilla. But its not. Its light but beautifully concentrated to where its still strong enough but not to where it would be offensive. Obviously you get spicy vanilla with a hint of lavendar. And its so beautiful. And it lasts</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2264491"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2264491#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2263804" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2263804" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SSBurn"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1298438"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1298438.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="SSBurn" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lattafa-Perfumes/Angham-96768.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.96768.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Angham"title="Angham"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2263804ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2263804" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1298438">SSBurn</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-28">08/28/24 11:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I dont mind this. It gives perfume but with a little something.  The vanilla is very is soft and lightly citrusy. You get hints of the ginger here and there that keep it lifted. Safe blind buy I feel.<br />
<br />
Update: dry down is just light vanilla musk very pretty. The sharper/brighter notes go away within an hour.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2263804"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2263804#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2263594" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2263594" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Lillylulu629"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2074234"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Lillylulu629" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2263594ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2263594" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2074234">Lillylulu629</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-28">08/28/24 08:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Ok, I struggled with this one at first. Initial spray this is not that girl. You really have to wait for the full dry down to appreciate it. Then its really beautiful. Basic? Yes. But I love basic perfumes. Its a scent you could literally wear anywhere and youre not going to offend someone. Its just an easy reach/easy wear. My husband who never compliments my perfumes said he really likes it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2263594"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2263594#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2262600" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2262600" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Sillykn"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1498127"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1498127.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Sillykn" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2262600ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2262600" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86); I have a 5ml decant and I don't know if I'd get a full bottle of this based on the performance I get from it especially at the price it's sold as.<br />
<br />
Edit: I tried it again and fell in love. bought a 50ml bottle. Don't know what happened but something just clicked and couldn't stop sniffing my arm after I put this on. definatly give this one a second try if you felt "meh" about it in the store!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; A bit strange</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2261842"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2261842#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2260261" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; It has a strong projection for about an hour before fading into a light, warm, addictive vanilla-cacao scent on clothes. I really dont want to spend my days sniffing my clothes. Sigh. padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2259733" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="bkingstar"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2219962"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2219962.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="bkingstar" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jovoy-Paris/Remember-Me-49435.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.49435.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Remember Me"title="Remember Me"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2259733ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2259733" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2219962">bkingstar</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-24">08/24/24 13:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My favorite fall/winter perfume for nights out and special events! I absolutely love this especially since ginger, vanilla, and lavender are some of my favorite notes. <br />
<br />
The lavender is really apparent on the initial spray but it gives this fragrance a sharpness that makes it more elegant. As it dries down, the lavender becomes less intense and you get more of a warm, spicy vanilla scent. It lasts so long for me as well and stays on my clothes for DAYS</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2259733"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2259733#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2259732" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2259732" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="dempon"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1574120"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1574120.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="dempon" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2259732ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2259732" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1574120">dempon</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-24">08/24/24 13:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Tried this today in store and im buying it definetly. Big lover of not-too-gourmand vanillas and subtle lavenders. Ariana grandes mod vanillas bigger sister.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2259732"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2259732#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2259402" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2259402" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Leibra"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2230861"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2230861.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Leibra" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2259402ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2259402" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85); align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2259402"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2259402#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2258474" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2258474" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sophiasnoseknows"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1765715"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="sophiasnoseknows" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2258474ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2258474" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1765715">sophiasnoseknows</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-23">08/23/24 09:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Cosy, comforting, and pleasant - this perfume has quickly become a daily go to despite my initial hesitance. When I first sampled it on paper I found to it be boring, like a rich tea biscuit, and reminiscent of YSL Libre (a scent I am not a fan of and that does not suit me), however when I sprayed it on my skin it seemed to melt together into a gentle bubble of sweet beige cashmere. The lavender adds an airy dimension to an otherwise simple vanilla, and the earthiness of ginger and cacao stop it from being too saccharine or gourmand. Although hardly an innovative or exciting scent, this perfume blends well with my skin chemistry and is a compliment getter. What I thought would be a uninspired cousin of Libre, has turned out to be one of my favourites.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2258474"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2258474#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2256754" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2253395" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Rubbergauze"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1751679"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1751679.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Rubbergauze" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chapel-Factory/Heresy-63967.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.63967.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Heresy"title="Heresy"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2253395ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2253395" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1751679">Rubbergauze</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-18">08/18/24 12:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I want to love this one, but it burns my skin. I'm still thinking about buying a 50ml because I've been dreaming of a sickly sweet floral marshmallow vanilla, and this one layers so well with a lavender perfume I have, it's just so creamy cloud lavender field sweet earthy vanille cake. That vanille caviar is sooo sexy, but there's a nasty hair spray chemical opening that's really overpowering and cheap smelling, and the dry down is too synthetic. I hope we get more floral gourmands in the future as a mutation of the vanille trend because it's an intoxicating mix </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2253395"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2253395#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2253006" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2253006" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ellbee"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2158047"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="ellbee" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2253006ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2253006" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2158047">ellbee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-18">08/18/24 03:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Initially, I was disappointed by this perfume - the lavender entirely overwhelmed any notes of vanilla in this perfume's composition. However, with time, I have grown to appreciate this lavender note as it seems to have mellowed out to work alongside the vanilla, as opposed to overpowering it. I will say that the lavender is still rather strong on my skin - even in the dry down - but it works nicely with the warmth of the ginger.<br />
<br />
I have received many compliments on this perfume despite not feeling like the sillage is very strong. Unfortunately, however, the lasting power is pretty poor.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2253006"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2253006#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2251451" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2251451" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="dasha11596"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1880169"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="dasha11596" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2251451ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2251451" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1880169">dasha11596</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-16">08/16/24 12:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The undertone of this perfume smells sour or like paint thinner or something. Its like a weird smell that someone tried covering up with something sweet. I dont understand how more people dont smell it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2251451"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2251451#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="83483" sentiment="all"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-positive-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Positive Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent1948399" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1948399" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="butterflybeauty"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1084621"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1084621.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="butterflybeauty" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dolce-Gabbana/Devotion-84951.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.84951.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Devotion"title="Devotion"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1948399ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck9x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1948399" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1084621">butterflybeauty</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-10">10/10/23 06:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Champagne and cinnabon by candlelight at a little bistro table, sitting with the love of my life listening to Norah Jones on a rainy spring evening. This is the first evening I wore Burberry Goddess and it describes exactly how this fragrance makes me feel. Romantic, sensual, elegant, soulful. It is comforting, extraordonary yet humble, and perfectly balanced. <br />
<br />
I feel like a goddess when I wear this ethereal perfume. <br />
<br />
Since that first night of wearing it, I have been finding it almost impossible to convince myself to wear any other perfume.<br />
<br />
I had been searching for that perfect vanilla fragrance for some time - a fragrance that accurately represents real vanilla, not the synthetic, plastic or overtly sweet version. I had not found it until Burberry Goddess. It is now the center jewel in my perfume crown.<br />
<br />
After having been diappointed by blind buys based on hyped up reviews, I was weary to buy a fragrance purely based on reviews. I was intrigued by just how many positive reviews this was getting and I had high hopes, but I maintained my cool. I did my reasearch and went to the fragrance shop and tried 7 different fragrances, some brand new, others very popular. Several were compared to Burberry Goddess. I sprayed each on a test strip. Goddess was the only one I found worthy of spraying on my skin for a test. <br />
<br />
At first sniff, it was beautiful, but I was not prepared for how much I would fall in love with it. After wearing it for a few hours, I realised this fragrance was only going to get better with time for me. I then decided to purchase the only bottle available- 50ml. I know I will continue to repurchase refills.<br />
<br />
For some time I have been working on narrowing down my perfume collection to those that I really love and will continue to purchase. This perfume is at the very top of that list and is the only vanilla centered fragrance on that list.<br />
<br />
Wikiparfum describes it as Ambery Oriental Gourmand, Amber Crisp  Citrus. I would say that is quite accurate.This is more oriental in nature and not a strong edible gourmand to me. It is not a cloying or overtly sickeningly sweet perfume. The perfume is of high quality and the vanilla is well balanced by the other notes. There are also additional notes that are listed on other sites and artcles that I do definitely detect in this perfume, although they are not listed on Fragrantica.<br />
<br />
This perfume opens with a zesty bergamot, an ever so delicate cozy lavender and a warm vanilla. I do detect a dusting of cacao. There is also a note of shiso leaves which lends a hint of spice. Indeed there are three different types of vanilla here that do form part of the perfume pyramid that does change as it wears. It has charachter and is not linear or basic. It has depth and wears differently depending on the weather or mood. I find this to be a reliable yet adaptable fragrance that can be worn for any occassion, any time of year, or by any age group. This is very feminine and not masculine at all to me. It is accurately Goddess. It is warm, soft and angelic.<br />
<br />
The perfumer Amandine Clerc-Marie has done a superb job and has given us something so special. This perfume has not been done before and stands uniquely on its own. I have tried it alongside others this has been compared to, but it is totally different. This perfume is certainly based on vanilla, but this is not like anything else in the perfume world. <br />
<br />
Natural vanilla is the second most expensive spice after saffron. Here, the vanilla caviar is directly from the vanilla pod, and this is the very expensive vanilla that is entirely processed by hand. There is an incredible quality to the vanilla in this perfume. It is natural and not synthetic vanilla. The synthetic version is what is found in most desserts and perfumes. This is not that.<br />
<br />
This perfume does justice and honour to vanilla. The vanilla pod comes from a very special tropical orchid that originated in Mexico and was honoured by the Totonac and Aztecs 900 years ago. In the early 1500s, the Spanish got it from them and brought it to Europe and then France brought it to the African islands in the Indian ocean. However the vanilla bean could not be reproduced without the bee from Mexico. A young African boy discovered that it could be hand pollinated. To this day, most of the natural vanilla comes from the African islands as a result of the time consuming process of hand pollination. A lot of love and care goes into natural vanilla production. I get a real sense of that in this perfume. It honours the sacred vanilla orchid.<br />
<br />
This perfume utilises natural vanilla from Africa and captures it into perfume oil through a more sustainable technique (Firgood). The final product is fittingly made in Spain, where vanilla was first brought to Europe.<br />
<br />
Everything about this perfume, from the scent to the bottle, box, and advertising has meaning and is perfectly executed. The gold design on the box represents the weatherproof garbardine fabric first made by Burberry in 1888. The bottle is beautifully crafted, with solid glass and a golden goddess medallion and cap, reminicent of classic perfume bottles. <br />
<br />
I love that it is both vegan and refillable. Responsibility matters to me.<br />
<br />
The golden medalion is like an angelic halo for the ethereal liquid.<br />
<br />
The atomiser is of high quality and distrubutes the golden liquid through a wide, soft spray. The liquid is an Eau de Parfum and is slighly oily due to the high content of natural perfume oils. This makes it last very long on my skin. As a skin scent, it lasts 8 hours or more. It stays on my watch strap for days. As with many natural perfume oils, it has only moderate projection.  I get about 4 hours of arm length projection before it gets closer to the skin, but I still get whiffs of it for more than 8 hours. It creates an aura of scent that surrounds me in soft comforting bliss. Those nearby also love it and want to get closer. <br />
<br />
The stunning perfume advertisement accurately captures this perfume. It is natural and effortlessly beautiful. In a time where so many women are divided, this perfume is unifying and compassionate. I have found so many of the You Tube reviews on this fragrance heartwarming. Women want to share the gift and magic of it with one another and in this, a wonderful sisterhood has been unveiled. We stand together as the beautiful lionesses that we are. Together, in care for eachother, we thrive. <br />
<br />
The advertisement has particular meaning for me. I am a Leo born in August and live in South Africa where the advertisement was filmed. It captures the depth and soul of the lioness and the continent from where the vanilla in this perfume originates. <br />
<br />
Overall this perfume deserves all the praise that it is getting. I love it!! It is a gift that keeps on giving and will stand the test of time as a new classic. 10/10. Thank you Burberry for this divine creation!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="1948399"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=1948399#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2099400" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2099400" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="wondervalley666"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1461605"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="wondervalley666" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Salum-Parfums/Cocoyster-90755.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.90755.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cocoyster"title="Cocoyster"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2099400ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck8x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2099400" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1461605">wondervalley666</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-21">03/21/24 07:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I wonder what has messed up everyones sense of smell? Covid? Bad diets? Staring at screens? <br />
<br />
This smells nothing like any mens scent or aftershave scent. Absolutely nothing. If you think this smells masculine, you must have only spent time around men who wear womens perfumes in your life. Or you havent spent time around many men at all. This is a girly vanilla bomb. Its one of the biggest vanilla overdose girly scents imaginable. Yes it has a soft clean laundry-style lavender note, that dances gently under a monsoon cloud of sweet strong vanilla. Pretty straightforward, utterly gorgeous.<br />
<br />
It was love at first sniff. Immediately ran to buy a full bottle. Im in my 30s and honestly paused for a moment to wonder if it was too young and girly for me as it reminded me of an aromatherapy scent I used as a tween. Then I decided I dont care, I wear what I want.<br />
<br />
Absolutely love this one. Recommend it to everyone. Such a mass pleasing lovely scent. <br />
<br />
Burberry scents of the past never appealed to me and made me smell like a drunk who bathed in gin. So glad they ditched the drunk waspy housewife profile they seemed to be geared toward and are going for more pretty and gourmand leaning scents. Hopefully they dont discontinue this gem due to the negative reviews from the young girls who seem to hate every perfume unless its straight gourmand vanilla without a hint of anything else. Judging by years of reading thousands of reviews, it seems they all HATE all flowers, they think they all smell like grandma, they hate woods and think woods smell like pickles, they hate spices and think they smell like men. They like vanilla, marshmallows, cupcakes, and sometimes caramel but Ive recently seen some younger girls tear apart a caramel scent because it smelled like burnt sugar. Lol I dont even know where to begin How boring not must be to have such simple basic tastes and to be so clueless you dont even know what real caramel is. <br />
<br />
Ignore the reviews from the tasteless and the basic. This is a simple, lovely, GORGEOUS perfume and anyone who isnt extremely picky to the point theyre insufferable will love it, if they love vanilla and lavender, of course.<br />
<br />
Side note: almost immediately I recognized this scent from 20+ years ago from the long discontinued/reformulated beyond recognition late 90s version of BBWs Tranquil Sleep. The old spray bottle with the little glass gems inside. BBW still makes a version of it but it hasnt smelled remotely close or performed a fraction as well in the past 15+ years, the magic is long gone from that one. This scent will scratch that itch if youre longing for the original Tranquil Sleep aroma.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="2099400"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=2099400#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1871018" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1871018" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Loevens"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1468985"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Loevens" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.83483.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Goddess"title="Goddess"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1871018ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck8x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1871018" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1468985">Loevens</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-04">07/04/23 10:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>*edit*<br />
So I tried it. It smells pretty much like I expected, except I seem to pick up more of the lavender, and do not detect the ginger. Wich is not a bad thing at all. It does remind me of mon Guerlain, wich I also quite like. Overall I think it's really nice. But overpriced.<br />
<br />
Somehow this looks like an AI generated perfume from start to finish. Take the lavender from Libre and mon Guerlain, the caviar from Mugler Womanity. Add Vanilla that seems to always be a hit and put it in a bottle that looks like it should have been from Versace, call it a frilly fluff word and there you go.... will I still try it? sure... I'm not above it, I mean just look at my perfume collection... it would probably fit right in.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="1871018"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=1871018#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1871431" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1871431" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Sereen84"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1364537"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1364537.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Sereen84" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1871431ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1871431" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1364537">Sereen84</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-05">07/05/23 00:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a wonderful vanilla perfume! The lavander here gives an aromatic freshness to the blend. The caviar note is in fact vanilla bean caviar. Aromatic sweet vanilla with moderate projection and sillage. I find the vanilla in here similar to the one in Black Opium Le Parfum.I am going to let it macerate a little though, I feel like the more it sits the better it gets.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1872390" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Scentfanatic87"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1574362"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Scentfanatic87" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1872390ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1872390" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1574362">Scentfanatic87</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-06">07/06/23 04:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This quite possibly the best Burberry perfume I have ever ever smelled. This vanilla is so mouth watering and blended to almost smell like creme brulee. 10/10 Burberry. Bravo!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="1872390"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=1872390#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="83483" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-negative-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Negative Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent1879620" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1879620" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="passionata20"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/39708"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.39708.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="passionata20" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1879620ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1879620" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/39708">passionata20</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-15">07/15/23 16:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>15. July 2023<br />
<br />
I tried this fragrance first time 2 weeks ago, exactly on its launch day, but then only on a paper strip. Was not impressed, projection was very weak (on paper). Today on my next journey i decided to try it again, but this time on skin. Mind you i was wearing both Chanel chance eau fraiche and Cartier Baiser voile edp on myself (neck and hair), but i sprayed once my right wrist with Goddess. So now 6 hrs later, after washing my hands several times i can still smell Goddess, but none of the other fragrances i was wearing myself. So lasting power is really good. But the downside is that i do not like the scent itself. It is just plain synthetic vanilla on me. Lavender is basically undetectable at any stage of fragrance development. It indeed is very close to YSL black Opium le parfum, but not the Libre (i see people compare these to each other, probably based on lavender note, but you barely can smell it in Goddess, as mentioned before). It is not very similar to Mon Guerlain, again because of the non detectable lavender note, more like Billie Eilish perfume. Goddess is all about synthetic smelling vanilla, nothing else, no development in here, so do not get over excited. There are plenty cheaper options on the market, that would smell of a better vanilla than this. <br />
Truly disappointing.  :(</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="1879620"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=1879620#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1912806" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1912806" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Bachi"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/25094"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.25094.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Bachi" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/ALT-Fragrances/Crystal-Smash-86984.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.86984.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Crystal Smash"title="Crystal Smash"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1912806ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1912806" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/25094">Bachi</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-27">08/27/23 11:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Decided to test this yesterday -sprayed on generously on my wrists and neck, since I do not shy away from perfume. The scent is sweet, warm, inviting. Lasted a nano-second. My friend and I could barely detect it after 90 min. And it was a humid afternoon. For a vanilla heavy eau de parfum, at this price point ($170), I expected more both in terms of longevity and silage. After 3 hours, it was simply gone. At home, I spritzed on VS Bare Vanilla and it lasted longer than Goddess. Ive been looking for a new sweet, gourmand that is elegant and while Goddess has those qualities, I wont spend the $ on a disappearing act.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="1912806"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=1912806#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1895600" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1895600" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tropic0"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/861540"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.861540.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="tropic0" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Escentric-Molecules/Escentric-01-846.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.846.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Escentric 01"title="Escentric 01"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1895600ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1895600" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/861540">tropic0</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-06">08/06/23 10:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If you like a strong generic vanilla, you will probably like it. Lavender is usually a fresh and interesting component to a fragrance however in Goddess it becomes a "caf" kinda vibe, not medicinal but a sharp coffeeshop vanilla. At the end of the day, hours after I sprayed my wrist it is still there so it has good staying power but personally I didn't find it pleasant at all, sharp, sweet and lacking personality.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="83483"comment_id="1895600"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html?ccid=1895600#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1901225" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1901225" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Madamevanille!"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1141186"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1141186.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Madamevanille!" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1901225ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1901225" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72);
